Posts.Content: andrearose wrote: Hello all -- I don't have lymphedema, but I've had cording in my arm since my lumpectomy last October. I've been going to a physical therapist and suddenly, one morning I noticed a hard lump in the center of my elbow about a cm above the crease. I thought it was part of the cord and showed it to the PT. She said it wasn't part of the cord but didn't seem worried and said it could be a swollen lymph vessel. It's still there weeks later and I am starting to FREAK OUT. Afraid it's a tumor/recurrence in a lymph node. I'm going in next week when I get back on vacation and the nurse said we could always biopsy it. Great. Which made me freak out even more. Has anyone had a hard, pebble like lump due to cording? And does anyone know if we even have lymph nodes in the center of elbow crease? Everything I see says lymph nodes are on the medial/inner side of the elbow. Thanks. Trying to breathe. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Hard lump just above elbow crease andrearose andrearose

Posts.Content: Jul 19, 2015 08:24PM andrearose wrote: I am so happy to report that the lump is gone. It was so hard so one day I let warm water run over it in the shower...The next day I just woke up and it felt a bit softer. And the next day - GONE. Thanks for the responses.
Posts.Title: Hard lump just above elbow crease andrearose andrearose

Posts.Content: Jul 10, 2015 08:25PM andrearose wrote: Thank you all for responding! It really does help to hear from people. I don't feel so alone. Musical: I haven't had my BP taken on that side. Leggy and farmer lucky: my husband felt it and thinks it's a cyst so that's what I'm hoping for! It is really tiny, like size of a grain of rice. I am really crossing my fingers that I'm just crazy.
